interventions.title: Vegetable Market Linkage Program – Kratie
interventions.summary: Establish direct buyer-farmer linkages between smallholder vegetable growers in Kratie province and urban supermarkets and processors in Phnom Penh. This includes training on GAP standards, post-harvest handling infrastructure, and digital market information services to reduce price volatility.

interventions.title: Climate-Smart Irrigation Support for Smallholders
interventions.summary: Support smallholder vegetable farmers in Kratie with climate-resilient drip irrigation and water harvesting technologies, reducing dependence on erratic rainfall and lowering production costs. Targeting women-led households as priority beneficiaries.

interventions.title: Cashew Value Addition and Processing Hub – Kratie
interventions.summary: Develop a community-based cashew processing facility in Kratie to move up the value chain from raw nut exports to processed kernels. Includes technology transfer, quality certification, and export market development targeting premium buyers in Japan and Europe.

interventions.title: Integrated Livestock Health and Productivity Program
interventions.summary: Scale up veterinary services, animal nutrition support, and breed improvement for cattle and pig farmers in Kratie. Program focuses on disease prevention, feed efficiency, and connecting farmers to formal slaughterhouses with better pricing mechanisms.

interventions.title: Safe Vegetable Supply Chain Development – Champasak
interventions.summary: Develop certified safe vegetable supply chains from Champasak to domestic urban markets and southern Thailand. Includes pesticide reduction training, traceability systems, and collective marketing arrangements for smallholder producer groups.

interventions.title: Cashew Plantation Rehabilitation and Certification – Champasak
interventions.summary: Rehabilitate aging cashew plantations in Champasak through improved agronomic practices, intercropping with shade trees, and organic certification pathways. Facilitates premium price premiums and supports biodiversity conservation objectives.

interventions.title: Sustainable Banana Production and Export Channels
interventions.summary: Transition banana production in Champasak from contract farming under Chinese operators to independent smallholder models with improved environmental standards. Develop alternative export channels to Vietnam and Thailand with better farmer terms.

interventions.title: VietGAP Vegetable Certification Program – An Giang
interventions.summary: Scale up VietGAP certification for vegetable producers in An Giang, targeting supermarket supply chains and export markets in ASEAN. Includes women farmer training centres, laboratory testing support, and digital certification management.

interventions.title: Premium Rice Brand Development and Market Access
interventions.summary: Develop a regional premium rice brand for An Giang origin varieties (ST25, Jasmine) targeting high-value domestic and export markets. Includes IP protection, packaging innovation, direct retail partnerships, and smallholder cooperative strengthening.

interventions.title: Sustainable Rice Intensification and Emission Reduction
interventions.summary: Scale alternate wetting and drying (AWD) practices and low-emission rice varieties across An Giang paddies, contributing to both carbon reduction and cost savings for farmers. Links with voluntary carbon market mechanisms for additional farmer income.

interventions.title: Integrated Mangrove-Shrimp Aquaculture Model
interventions.summary: Promote integrated mangrove-shrimp aquaculture in An Giang coastal zones to improve environmental sustainability and access premium eco-certified markets. Includes ASC certification pathways, mangrove restoration, and community-based management structures.

recommendations.title: Strengthen Buyer-Farmer Linkages Across All Value Chains
bullets: Map and engage anchor buyers in each value chain willing to commit to structured sourcing arrangements with smallholders
Facilitate multi-year supply agreements with quality-linked price premiums to incentivise farmer investment
Support digital market information platforms to provide real-time price transparency to farmers and producer groups
Establish grievance mechanisms for contract enforcement and dispute resolution

recommendations.title: Expand Access to Value Chain Finance for Smallholders
bullets: Partner with MFIs and commercial banks to develop value chain finance products linked to purchase orders
Pilot warehouse receipt financing for commodities including cashews and premium rice
Design blended finance instruments to crowd in private sector investment in processing infrastructure
Integrate financial literacy training into all producer group support activities

recommendations.title: Mainstream WEE Across All Value Chain Interventions
bullets: Conduct gender analysis for each value chain to identify key barriers and opportunities for women
Set minimum 40% women participation targets for all training and capacity building activities
Prioritise women-led producer groups and cooperatives in market linkage programs
Address time poverty constraints by co-locating services and providing childcare support at events
Track and report gender-disaggregated data across all outcome indicators

recommendations.title: Integrate Climate-Smart Agriculture and Environmental Standards
bullets: Adopt climate risk screening for all new interventions and investments
Scale proven CSA practices including conservation tillage, integrated pest management, and water-efficient irrigation
Develop environmental compliance roadmaps for value chains with significant environmental footprints
Connect farmers to climate finance mechanisms including carbon credits and green bonds
Embed biodiversity considerations into certification and standards work

recommendations.title: Engage Government and Policy for Enabling Environment
bullets: Work with provincial governments to streamline business registration and certification processes
Advocate for improved rural infrastructure investment in roads, electricity, and telecommunications
Support development of national quality standards for priority commodities
Build government capacity for market monitoring and agricultural data systems
Engage national trade policy processes to improve export facilitation for smallholder products

recommendations.title: Ensure Persons with Disabilities are Not Left Behind
bullets: Conduct disability inclusion assessments for each target area and value chain
Adapt training materials and delivery methods to be accessible for persons with disabilities
Partner with DPOs (Disabled Persons Organisations) to reach and include PWD farmers
Track participation and outcomes for persons with disabilities as a disaggregated group
Ensure physical accessibility of any project-supported facilities and marketplaces

sharedChallenge.title: Shared Challenge: Climate-Driven Market Volatility
sharedChallenge.description: Across Cambodia (Kratie), Laos (Champasak), and Vietnam (An Giang), smallholder farmers in all targeted value chains face compounding challenges from climate change and market volatility. Irregular rainfall patterns disrupt planting calendars, post-harvest losses increase with temperature extremes, and price shocks cascade through thin rural markets. This cross-cutting challenge requires coordinated responses that build both climate resilience and market system stability simultaneously.

designImplications: Design interventions that address climate risk and market risk as interlinked, not siloed, challenges
Build early warning systems that integrate weather forecasting with market price information
Support index-based agricultural insurance to protect farmer income against climate shocks
Diversify value chain programming to reduce household dependence on single commodities
Invest in climate-resilient infrastructure (storage, irrigation, road access) as public goods enabling multiple value chains
Establish cross-country learning networks among producers, traders, and extensionists facing similar challenges
Ensure women and marginalised groups are central to climate adaptation planning, not afterthoughts
Align with national climate policies (NDCs) and green growth frameworks to leverage additional public finance

crossCuttingThemes.description: Digital tools (market apps, e-extension, digital payments) offer high leverage across all value chains but require attention to digital literacy and access gaps particularly among women and older farmers.
Value chain interventions targeting vegetables, livestock, and rice have direct nutrition implications. Dietary diversity should be tracked alongside income metrics.
Rural youth are disengaging from agriculture due to poor returns and social status. Interventions that raise professionalism and profitability of farming can help reverse this trend.
